results.description:
When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

 

Art of Living Secaucus Center
Email: <a>[masked]</a>
Phone: <a>[masked]</a>
Meetup: <a>http://www.meetup.com/Lets-Meditate-Secaucus/</a>;
Twitter: https://twitter.com/#secaucusaol
Web: http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/secaucus
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/secaucus

results.description:
Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation: 

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Outdoors
ADMISSION: Free

DESCRIPTION:


Please come join us for a hike at the south portion of the Palisades Interstate Park, New Jersey, located just across the river from New York City. This is a very scenic hike with fantastic panoramic views from above the cliffs and along the shore of the Hudson River. The trail is mostly flat. You’ll see many nice lookout viewpoints, the George Washington Bridge, picnic area, a boat basin with many beautiful boats. For those of you who have not been to hiking before. This is a good chance to break in. This hike is suitable for beginners. You'll get a chance to learn some basic fundamentals about hiking, learn something about the terrain, the woods, etc.

Starting from Fort Lee Historic Park, hike north on the Long Path (Aqua Trail) along the sidewalk on Hudson Terrace, then up the steel steps beyond the George Washington Bridge and into the woods. Follow the Long Path north, exploring some of the unmarked but well-defined side trails overlooking the Bridge. Continue on Aqua trail to north of Allison Park to St. Peter’s College, then turn right at Englewood Cliff Entrance then hike south along the shore at Boat Basin to Ross Dock Picnic Area, continue on the white-blazed Shore Trail south beneath the Bridge, passing Hazard’s Dock, for another 0.5 mi., where it will turn uphill to the southern park entrance, back on Hudson Terrace, turn north on the multi-use path and return to the starting point.

ATTRACTIONS:

• Great View of the George Washington Bridge

• Little Stone Castle

•  Giant Stairs

• GreenBrook Waterfall

• Palisades Interstate Park

DIFFICULTY: Easy
DISTANCES: 6 Miles
DURATION: 4 Hours

RECOMMENDED ITEMS TO BRING:
• 2x 1 Lite of bottle water
• Lunch
• Snacks & Fruits
• Sun Screen
•

RECOMMENDED CLOTHES TO WEAR:
• Hat
• Sun Glasses
• Warm Clothing  
• Hiking Boots or Shoes
• Lightweight Back Pack
• Lightweight workout pants

TRANSPORTATION: $[Edit]
[Link]

MAPS:

http://www.njpalisades.org/pdfs/trailmapMiddle.pdf

WEATHER:

http://www.wunderground.com/q/zmw:07024.1.99999


REFERENCE:

http://www.njpalisades.org/hikesEasy.html


DISCLAIMER:
When you RSVP "Yes" to an event, or participate in an event, please understand that you are responsible for your own safety and well-being, and will hold no one else liable in case of personal injury or any mishap. You agree not to hold the meetup group's organizer, assistant organizers, event organizers, hosts, or any other group members responsible for any injuries or issues that may occur at any time before, during or after an event. You are personally responsible for obtaining essential information about an event, making necessary preparations for participating in the event, and ensuring your own safety and well-being. Your RSVP of "Yes" on the event page or attendance of an event signifies your full understanding and acceptance of the terms of this liability waiver. We reserve the rights to limit this event to physically fit people.


END

results.description:
Meetup/Hangout – 9:45 am

Whole Foods (Union Square) -- upstairs cafe. Show up a bit early to say hi, chat, and drop off any thing you don’t want to run with: jackets, bags, phones, etc. Somebody will always stay to watch the stuff.

Run – 10:00 am

Run 1 mile, 3 miles, 5 miles, or whatever you want. We'll head to the West Side Highway together. No pressure and no limits. Totally informal. Lots of different paces for lots of different people. Even walking speed is encouraged!

Brunch – 10:45 am

Whole Foods has ALL THE FOOD. Come get some.

What to expect: a seriously fun group of runners who definitely do not take running too seriously . We will meet, chat, RUN, stretch, chat, EAT BREAKFAST and then leave. It’s that easy. First we run, then we eat!

results.description:
Updated December 18th, 2015


WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 


[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
Let's have a Boxing Day trail run! We'll meet up by Lloyd's Carrot Cake. From there, you have the choice of running in Van Cortlandt Park across the street (in groups of 19 or less) or elsewhere in the Bronx.

Due to construction, it is not currently possible to run the old Holiday Marathons loop. I've done some research and identified a detour that joins back up with the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail. It doesn't involve and bushwhacking but does lengthen the loop to ~7.5 miles.

I'll be running a loop or two around the modified Holiday Marathons course at about 9-10 minutes per mile.

This PDF map of Van Cortlandt Park showing the Holiday Marathons course with the detour might be useful.


As always, please view the group's About page and make sure you understand your responsibilities as an event participant.
results.name: Boxing Day Trail Run in the Bronx

When people think of the most important religious concepts of such as divine birth and even resurrection, they automatically think that these ideas originated with Christianity roughly 2,000 years ago.  In actuality they were first conceived in the spiritual and philosophical works of Ancient Kemet, the crown jewel of early civilization.  In fact the rise of early Christian church was directly responsible for extinguishing the Kemetic language in the fourth century AD in order to prevent the linking of its beginnings to this ancient "pagan" tradition.  When Jean-Francois Champollion was finally able to publish the first correct translation of the Medu Neter (hieroglyphics) in 1822, the spiritual traditions of Ancient Kemet were able to be interpreted after nearly 1,500 years of silence.

Join the Center for the Restoration of Ma'at for an informative and provocative discussion of the Kemetic origins of Christianity as we tour the Metropolitan Museum of Art.  The tour will not only focus on the museum's impressive Ancient Egyptian collection of over 26,000 artifacts, but will also sections of the Greek and Roman galleries.  Over the course of our engaging afternoon, we will paint a comprehensive picture of Kemetic spirituality while describing the birth of Christianity in the Mediterranean. Is this tour appropriate for Christians?  Absolutely!  Our inquiry is not focused on dismantling Christianity.  We hope all participants will have an appreciation for its African origins at the conclusion. After all,  "to be ignorant of the past is to remain a child".

Your tour will run approximately 2 1/2 hours and will cost $30 for adults and 
$20 for students.  Please RSVP as soon as possible as limited spaces are 
available.  Pay by cash, money order, or credit.  Please meet in the museum 
lobby at least 15 minutes prior!

Tour led by 

Jabari Osaze, Heru DjedenMa'at Aten-Ra

FREE Companion Lecture Scheduled Saturday, December 26 at 5 PM  


Register for both!

results.description:
Join us, on another day out in the city or better yet this time in the outer boroughs. 

We have been on hiatus for a while, but we are back! Continuing this season with trotting the great bridges that have been used to get thousands of people to and from the city each day.

Next up is the Roosevelt Island Bridge! 

There will be a few stops to admire the sights and so we can also talk about what we see.

We will all collectively meet inside NYC Penn Station in front of the Information booth in the rotunda (imaged below). 

http://i.imgur.com/9XZaZYs.jpg?1

We will leave 30 minutes, past the hour. So get there EARLY! 

NOTE: We will NOT be waiting on anyone past 11:30 AM. It is unfair for those who get here early, so please plan to get here early.  If you will be late, please Un-RSVP from the event, catching up with the rest of the group would be neigh impossible.

If it is easier, you can wait on us to arrive at the Astoria station. Just inform us ahead of time if you intend to do this.

We will then make our way to N or R line train, taking it to Astoria - Ditmars Blvd. 

We will make our first trek from the station to Astoria Park. Following the shore line from there South through residential area. Then we will come by Socrates Sculpture Park while making our way around the river bend through Rainey Park (hope for no rain). We will take Vernon Blvd till we reach Roosevelt Island Bridge, where we will cross it to get on the island's namesake.

We cross back then to Manehattan using the air tram. From there we draw the meetup to a close. We will go off to a venue to eat for those staying a bit long but no one is obligated to stay if they are scheduled to be somewhere else.

Notice about necessary fare: For use, the NYC subway will cost $2.75 per ride. So bring an estimated $8 dollars for transit when we start out.

As a recommendation of this being a hike, it is important to keep well hydrated. So bring along some bottled water. There is some water fountains in the parks, but the first option is highly recommended, this time.

Other recommendations would be possibly a light snack if you get a munchies moment while on the hike, also a small towel.

After we finish our hike and make it back to where we began, we will get down into a local eatery to cool down and regain our energy from our successful hike before we break off and say our farewells.

Any other questions or recommendations, please let us know in the comments. Phone number will be posted on the morning of the Meetup.
results.name: The Trotting Crusaders of NYC

results.description:
course on a

If you are an international artists or creative professional wanting to work in the US, this Meetup is for you. This Meetup is intended for international creative professional looking to work in the US as freelancers.

CONTEMPORARY ART PRACTICE is an organization that develops tools and resources to support artists and creative professionals develop strong and successful careers.

This Meetup is structure to be a free 1 hour online info session followed by a 2 hours course.

During the info session you will learn:

1. What is an O1 visa? (also known as "Artist Visa")

2. Who is eligible for an O1 visa

3. What documents you need to apply

4. How much does it cost

5. How long does it take to put together

6. How can you build a good case for your application

If after the info session you decide you want to know more, you can stay for our following 2 hour course. We will cover:

1. How to find a sponsor

2. How to reach for recommenders

3. How to write letters of recommendation to fit USCIS requirements

4. How to organize your evidences and build categories

5. How to know if you need a consultation letter from the union related to your field

6. How to find employers

7. How to organize your itinerary

8. What is a deal memo and how it should look like

9. How to organize yourself to get it done as fast and painless as possible

We will dedicate the last half and hour for Q&A so you get clear about all your concerns and questions about this process.

Maximum of 7 people per course.

The first 1 hour info session is Free and the cost of the following course is $250 per person.

You will leave with an action plan under your arm and vast knowledge on how to tackle every task of your application process. You will also have access to an archive of samples of letters of recommendation, deal memo, itineraries and other useful sources to make this process easier and build a strong case for your O1 visa application.

Join us for this Meetup! You will get very valuable information and you will get to meet people to support you along the process.

Special discounts: You can get a 10% if you pay before the day of the course (message us for paying details). Also, if you bring a friend to the course, you get 10% discount for you and 10% for your friend. Also, you organize a group of 5 people and you get the course for FREE!

Can't make it to this date? We teach this course every other Saturday and we also provide one-on-one courses in New York and Online. Visit our website for more details.
results.name: O1 Visa: Working Visa for Artists and Creative Professionals Course in Brooklyn

Loren handles the attendance on all our events, that we all know, but what many are not aware of is that she’s also becomes the organizer when I’m not able to perform in that capacity. She’s done this on many occasions smoothly and without a hitch. The perfect example was the last Gift of Life Foundation "Walk For Life" at Eisenhower Park. My computer was down and Loren took over without fanfare. Loren is also my memory and my motivator, nagging me until I finally put something on the Boardwalk schedule. So on Saturday, Loren this walks for you to show that we all appreciate what you do.---Lee

results.description:
www.TheHatefulEight.com

In THE HATEFUL EIGHT, set six or eight or twelve years after the Civil War, a stagecoach hurtles through the wintry Wyoming landscape. The passengers, bounty hunter John Ruth (Russell) and his fugitive Daisy Domergue (Leigh), race towards the town of Red Rock where Ruth, known in these parts as “The Hangman,” will bring Domergue to justice. Along the road, they encounter two strangers: Major Marquis Warren (Jackson), a black former union soldier turned infamous bounty hunter, and Chris Mannix (Goggins), a southern renegade who claims to be the town’s new Sheriff. Losing their lead on the blizzard, Ruth, Domergue, Warren and Mannix seek refuge at Minnie’s Haberdashery, a stagecoach stopover on a mountain pass. When they arrive at Minnie’s, they are greeted not by the proprietor but by four unfamiliar faces. Bob (Bichir), who’s taking care of Minnie’s while she’s visiting her mother, is holed up with Oswaldo Mobray (Roth), the hangman of Red Rock, cow-puncher Joe Gage (Madsen), and Confederate General Sanford Smithers (Dern). As the storm overtakes the mountainside stopover, our eight travelers come to learn they may not make it to Red Rock after all…

THE HATEFUL EIGHT marks a continuation of the long-standing relationship between the celebrated filmmaker and the Weinsteins, who have collaborated on all of Tarantino’s films from RESERVOIR DOGS through DJANGO UNCHAINED.


https://youtu.be/gnRbXn4-Yis


The exclusive roadshow engagement that THE HATEFUL EIGHT is embarking on will replicate the special event releases that films used to receive in the early and mid-twentieth century. They screened a longer version of the film than would have been shown in wide release, including a musical overture to start the show and an intermission between acts, and moviegoers received a special souvenir program. THE HATEFUL EIGHT roadshow experience will offer moviegoers all three special features. Roadshows were the gold standard for exhibiting pictures like LAWRENCE OF ARABIA, GONE WITH THE WIND, CLEOPATRA, BATTLE OF THE BULGE, THE TEN COMMANDMENTS and BEN HUR.

TWC and Tarantino’s presentation of THE HATEFUL EIGHT will mark the widest 70mm release that the industry has seen in over twenty years. The film will open in 44 markets including New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Philadelphia, Dallas, San Francisco, Boston, Atlanta, Washington DC, Houston, Detroit, Phoenix, Seattle, Tampa, Minneapolis, Denver, Miami, Cleveland, Orlando, Sacramento, St. Louis, Portland, Pittsburgh, Milwaukee, Charlotte, Raleigh-Durham, Baltimore, San Diego, Nashville, Kansas City, San Antonio, West Palm Beach, Birmingham, Las Vegas, Albuquerque, Oklahoma City, Austin, New Orleans, Providence, Knoxville, Santa Barbara, Toronto, Montreal, Vancouver. Quentin and cast members from THE HATEFUL EIGHT will be touring the country making surprise appearances in select cities at 70mm roadshow showings.

Not since the 1966 film Khartoum starring Charlton Heston and Laurence Olivier has a film been shot in Ultra Panavision 70 format. In 2012, TWC distributed Paul Thomas Anderson’s acclaimed film THE MASTER in a similar 70mm format. Beloved by filmmakers and cinephiles for its wide-scope and high-resolution image quality, Ultra Panavision70mm stock captures nearly twice the landscape of the more common 35mm and digital styles. Because of its unique quality and its importance to the art of filmmaking, Quentin, TWC, and a number of other major Hollywood directors and studios have negotiated deals with Kodak to continue production of 70mm and other film formats despite their higher costs and complexity of use.

The lead cast for THE HATEFUL EIGHT includes Samuel L. Jackson (DJANGO UNCHAINED), Kurt Russell (ESCAPE FROM NEW YORK), Jennifer Jason Leigh (MRS. PARKER AND THE VICIOUS CIRCLE), Walton Goggins (Justified), Demian Bichir (A BETTER LIFE), Tim Roth (RESERVOIR DOGS), Michael Madsen (RESERVOIR DOGS), and Bruce Dern (NEBRASKA).
results.name: Celebrate Christmas Grindhouse style with THE HATEFUL EIGHT!

Event Type: Museum

Admission Price: Pay as You Wish ($1.00 Suggested)

Description:

The Brooklyn Museum is an art museum located in the New York City borough of Brooklyn. At 560,000 square feet, the museum is New York City's third largest in physical size and holds an art collection with roughly 1.5 million works. At the Brooklyn Museum you can explore an extensive and comprehensive permanent collection that includes ancient Egyptian masterpieces, African art, European painting, decorative arts, period rooms, and contemporary art. You'll also experience intelligent, cutting-edge exhibitions and programs that reflect a fresh view of traditional and historical works as well as engagement with today's most important artists and artistic practices and ideas.

Collections:

• American Art

• Arts of Africa

• Arts of the Americas

• Arts of the Islamic World

• Arts of the Pacific Islands

• Asian Art

• Contemporary Art

• Decorative Arts

• Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art

• European Art

Reference Links:

https://www.brooklynmuseum.org/

http://www.yelp.com/biz/brooklyn-museum-brooklyn-2

Disclaimer:

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/pages/Disclaimer/

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.
No power shots allowed.
If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.
If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.
Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.
Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

Sara D. Roosevelt Park, Nike Field
Take the F train to 2nd Avenue Lower East Side, and walk for about 3 minutes on Chrystie Street to the Nike Field between Stanton St & Rivington St
New York, NY 10002
Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.

What to bring with you:
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee:
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for, permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:
Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled.
The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Slánte for brunch and a Pint or Two:

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

results.description:
Let's play pool on the final Saturday of 2015! Five days before the year ends! It's also the day after Christmas, so if you get any sucky gifts take your anger out on the pool balls with some powerful break shots!

The fun officially starts at 2pm with UNLIMITED play until 8 pm for only $20! Pay at the front desk and tell whomever is working the desk you're there for the meet up and they'll point you in our direction. All skill levels are welcome! I hope to see you there! Basic 8-Ball rules:

To avoid confusion and debate, here are some good rules for playing 8-ball. These are not the APA league rules, They're not "Mike's Biker bar" rules, they are the BCA rules which govern most pro pool matches.

-- The table is open (free choice of group) after the break, no matter which ball(s) are pocketed.
-- A scratch or other foul results in cue-ball in hand ANYWHERE on the table for the opponent.
-- Hitting one of your opponent's balls before one of your own on a shot is a foul.
-- Missing or scratching on the 8-ball is NOT loss of game if the 8-ball is still on the table.
-- The ball and pocket must be called unless the shot is obvious.
-- The number of cushions (or other balls) the ball bounces off need NOT be called.
-- The cue-ball or ANY other ball must touch a cushion or be pocketed after a shot or it's a foul.
-- The 8 ball must always be called.

results.description:
Basic Ground Rules for Participation

Please wear either a blue/black or white shirt to make things easy (Preferably bring both in case we need to mix the teams more evenly).


no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc. If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF. If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...). If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.

What is Ultimate Frisbee? In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee. You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.
results.name: NEW TIME - Saturday Ultimate Frisbee (Anderson Park)

****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 15 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE AND THE TRANSPORTATION SECTION.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Bring comfortable walking shoes and EXTRA LAYERS OF CLOTHING.

Have one extra fare on your Metro Card because we will be travelling on a MTA NYC bus (in the middle of the walk) to a second spectacular holiday lights display. At that point, if you want to bail out, you can take the Q 46 bus at Union Turnpike to the Kew Gardens/Union Turnpike subway station stop (the "F" train) or the Q 17 bus at Union Turnpike/188th Street back to the Jamaica subway station stop at 179th Street and Hillside Avenue (the "F" train). For those who want to continue, we will take the Q 76 bus at Union Turnpike/Francis Lewis Boulevard (in the opposite direction) to another Queen's neighborhood to look at a spectacular holiday lights display (arguably the best holiday lights display in the United States).

This is a sociable walk along a very scenic route filled with interesting places. Although I will comment on some things (the architecture/history of Jamaica Estates and the background of these two spectacular holiday lights displays) along the way, this is not one of my walking tours.

This walk is about 3 1/2 miles and moderate paced (not slow paced). If you think that you will be lagging behind with a moderate pace, then this type of walk is not good for you.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John, the event host, who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photograph. Thank you again.

Description: We'll first walk around Jamaica Estates with its eclectic architecture, including Tudor-style, modern ranch, clapboard Colonials and brick Georgian-style mansions.  

The original owners of one of these magnificent mansions were English and French, so they decided to build the front part of that house in the English Tudor style and the rear in French Provincial.

The Jamaica Estates Company, which developed the community's 503 acres at the early 20th century, laid out lots to preserve existing trees; therefore, some of these huge oak, maple, elm, and chestnut trees are more than 200 years old.

When we are in Jamaica Estates, we'll stop at a house that has an amazing display of holiday lights, which can actually be seen from blocks away. The house and fence around this large property is decorated, and there's a Nativity scene, an army of soldiers, many life-size holiday characters, a few menorahs, moving model trains, Rudolph and his reindeers winding their way around the garden, and a Santa Claus in an air balloon suspended from a big tree. At the entranceway, there's a robotic human-size Santa Claus that moves around and looks so real! Not only is this big house one of the few homes lit up in Jamaica Estates, but also one of the best in the city.

Next, we'll take a MTA NYC bus (have one extra fare on your Metro Card) to the next location. At that point (which will be about 4:30 PM or 5:00 PM), if you want to bail out, you can take the Q 46 bus at Union Turnpike to the Kew Gardens/Union Turnpike station subway stop (the "F" train) or the Q 17 bus at Union Turnpike/188th Street back to the Jamaica station subway stop at 179th Street and Hillside Avenue (the "F" train). For those who want to continue, we'll take the Q 76 bus (in the opposite direction) at Union Turnpike/Francis Lewis Boulevard for about 12 to 15 minutes to another Queen's neighborhood  to look at a second spectacular holiday lights display (possibly the best holiday lights display in the United States). 

The holiday decorations on this house are unbelievable. Just about every inch of the house is lit up and the lights are visible to planes landing at nearby LaGuardia Airport! The family's home features 300 blow-molds (those huge figurine-like characters that light up), more than 100 animatronics and at least 300,000 bright lights. Displayed are classic figures of Santa and snowmen, music, and moving model trains. These decorations also include a virtual Santa Claus in a second-story window that is achieved with a DVD player and a projector. The festivities extend into the family's house, where the living room is filled with decorations and there is a 10-foot tree that the family cut down upstate


After we finish looking at this house, we'll briefly look at more holiday light decorations in this neighborhood and then take a MTA NYC bus, the Q 76, from Francis Lewis Boulevard back to the starting point. The bus ride will take about 20 to 25 minutes to return back to the "F" subway train stop at 179th Street and Hillside Avenue about 6:50 PM.


We'll encounter displays that are very bright (like blast or flood lighting), so bring your sunglasses just in case!

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after lunch) at 2:30 PM. Allow extra traveling time because you will have to take the "F" subway train to the last stop in Queens.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is outside of the front of McDonalds Restaurant. The address is McDonalds Restaurant, 18125 Hillside Avenue (between 181st Street and Avon Street), Jamaica, NY. After you get off the subway stop, walk about three blocks east along Hillside Avenue and go past 180th Street, Midland Parkway and 181st Street.

Before the walk, restrooms are located in the back of McDonalds Restaurant. After we start the walk, we'll have limited opportunities for a restroom stop because we'll be walking in mostly two residential neighborhoods. There might be a few places for a restroom stop on Union Turnpike.

Public Transportation: Take the "F" subway train to 179th Street and Hillside Avenue in Jamaica (Queens), New York. This is the last stop on the "F" subway train in Queens. After getting off the train, walk about three blocks east along Hillside Avenue and go past 180th Street, Midland Parkway, and 181st Street. McDonalds Restaurant is between 181st Street and Avon Street on Hillside Avenue.

Driving Directions:  You might be able to park your car two or three blocks north of Hillside Avenue in Jamaica Estates. From Hillside Avenue, go north on Midland Parkway (past the "Jamaica Estates" Gatehouse). Midland Parkway is about one block west from McDonalds Restaurant on Hillside Avenue. On the weekend, parking is usually available on Midland Avenue or one of the side streets in Jamaica Estates. Read the parking signs carefully because Jamaica Estates has a private security force that looks for illegally parked cars.

Finishing Time/Place: This walk will finish about 6:50 PM back at McDonalds Restaurant, the starting point.

Rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions or the forecast is for rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday morning. This walk will only happen in good weather conditions. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do cancel the walk, I will also post a cancellation notice on the Discussion Board, and then reschedule the walk.
results.name: Jamaica Estates Walk Plus Two Spectacular Holiday Lights Displays! (Dec. 26)

results.description:
Once again, it's ON! This adult event will be open and free to everyone - members and their guests - just be sure to add your 'pluses' when you RSVP so that we have an idea how many we should expect. When you arrive, please ask for Daniel, who'll introduce you to other members of the group. From there, you can order some food/drink or you can simply get started on playing your favorite board & card games.

As for the room layout, there will be a number of different "Board Game" stations which are tables with different board games already set up - all you will have to do is pick a station and wait for some more players, or simply join a game already in progress! 

Decks of cards for Spades, Tonk, etc. • Uno • Taboo • Cards Against Humanity • Dominoes • Battle of the Sexes • Chess / Checkers • Connect Four • Cranium • Guesstures • Jenga • Scrabble & more

There will also be some open tables for people who would like to bring their own games - feel free to bring your favorite.

Drink specials will include house red, white, or rose for $5. Again, this event is free and you are not required to buy food or drinks, but let's help support Manhattan Brew & Vine as they are supporting us for use of their space.


The event starts at 3pm and is officially over at 8pm, but may run a little longer, depending on energy/turnout/interest.


If you have any questions, feel free to post them below in the comments section or call/text Daniel @ 774.275.3646.

Directions to Manhattan Brew & Vine - 998 Columbus Avenue

Take the B or C subway trains to 110th Street, walk 2 avenues west to Columbus Avenue then down one block to 109th street. The venue is on the corner of 109th street & Columbus Avenue.

results.description:
It's that time of year again - Holiday House Party Time!! 

This year Heidi has generously opened her home for the Smutty Book Club Annual Holiday House Party! She even has a back yard! The party will be in Bedford Stuyvesant, near the A & C lines.  And before you start saying it's too far, I mapped it. It's 35 minutes from Nelly Spillane's, 52 minutes from Yankee Stadium, and 55 minutes from the Astoria Beer Garden. Helen as always is screwed, but that's because everything is far from Staten Island.  

TO ATTEND:

You must have already attended a Smutty Book club event or meeting to attend the holiday party.  This is the avoid any weird strangers.  Only weird friends are welcome :) The address will be sent out to each person individually.  

DRESS CODE: 


Ugly sweaters and other holiday dress. There will be prizes for best outfits :) 

POTLUCK

Heidi will make her famous punch. Please bring one food item, and whatever you want to drink besides punch.


HOMEWORK: 


Since we couldn't seem to find any sexy holiday themed books, we decided to each write our own sexy holiday story and read them at the party! Please bring a story, poem or except of 300 words to the party.  The theme is the holidays - Santa, Hanukkah, elves, snowmen, etc.  Filthy is encouraged: "He went down her chimney," "Deck her halls," "Ho," etc.  

Please print your work double spaced in Times New Roman 12 point.  The stories will be mixed up and we will each pick a story at random to read aloud.  You can own up to your story afterwards if you like, or forever stay shy. 

I think that's it. See you on the 26th!!!!! 

Dawn
results.name: Smutty Book Club Annual Holiday House Party!

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

(Look for the Meetup table near the piano.)

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
In this companion lecture to our African Origins of Christianity Tour of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Jabari Osaze provides an even more in-depth analysis
of the history of early Christianity. This history clearly traces the primary concepts of Christianity to Ancient Kemet through its influence in the Mediterranean region.
Ancient Kemet's intricate spiritual system was fully formed thousands of years before most systems in the European world. 

As this is a multimedia presentation, you will see dozens of supporting images. Brother Osaze will also describe how the esoteric symbols of Ancient Kemet and other the "mystery" based traditions in the Mediterranean region were appropriated by early Christians who were then divided in a large array of groups. When some of these Christian groups sought to utilize Christianity as a unifying factor in the Roman Empire, they claimed many of these ancient symbols for themselves. This bloody history is unfamiliar today. Most who claim to study the history of Christianity simple acquaint themselves with one source; the Bible. Fortunately this story can be reconstructed, many of Christianity's most familiar characteristics can
be found in these earlier traditions. 

This lecture will describe many of these characteristics and illustrate their African origins. Including but not limited to:

The Concept of a Spiritual (Virgin) Birth Crucifixion
Divine resurrection to be shared by the righteous
Divine birth heralded by Three Kings
Baptism and Communion
Faultless death in order for others to enter "heaven"

Don't miss this powerful lecture! Ample time will be provided for discussion and debate. The point of this interactive lecture is not to dismantle Christianity, but to
properly situate it's origins.


Lecture Facilitated by Jabari Osaze, Heru DjedenMa'at Aten-Ra

Companion Museum Tour Scheduled Saturday, December 26 at 11 AM  

Attend both and receive a FREE DVD!
results.name: African Origins of Christianity: A FREE Interactive, Multimedia Lecture

results.description:
As part of our outreach to T.O.O.O.L.(The Open Organization Of LockPickers}, we are sponsoring a monthly Lockpicking event to encourage like minded individuals to gather, greet, and pick the night away!!!  No experience required, just a desire to learn is all that is needed.  Anyone can learn to pick, if you don't believe us, come on down to MakerBar and try it for yourself!

At this time, we are also requesting donations of locks, ...old rusty pad locks(or shiny new ones), door locks (old or shiny[we love shiny locks]), combination locks, handcuffs (with or without keys), prison shackles(no questions asked...wink, wink), practice locks, bicycle locks, key safes, combination safes, etc... in general anything that has a lock may be donated.   If you have any of the above mentioned locks, and would be happy to donate them, please bring them with you when you come to help increase the diversity of locks to pick.

Come have a beer (or two[we don't count]) with us, and have fun picking away with fellow pickers!! See you there!!

***As Always we remind newcomers to follow the two Golden Rules of Lock-Sport.....

1. Do Not Pick A Lock Without the Owners Consent (Your Neighbors Lock..No Good..)

2. Do Not Pick A Lock You Rely On.(Your house lock would fall into this category.)

Happy Picking!!!!***

**Open to the Public**


In parallel with OPEN CRAFT NIGHT:

Come on down and make stuff! Don't be shy, we love seeing new faces and meeting new MakerBarbians. Bring a project in any state, an idea, or just  come to hang out with us while we work on projects, WARNING spontaneous brainstorms are on the forecast.

This event is free and open to the public.   It is an ideal time to stop in and see what the MakerBar is all about. Doors open at 7PM

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar
results.how_to_find_us: Give us a call at 1-855-MAKERBAR(625-3722) And we'll help you find the way!

results.description:
Join a whole bunch of singles in the 21 to 49 age range as we hop from Astoria bar to bar wearing ugly sweaters, dancing, prancing, frolicking and causing all kinds of non-violent havoc on the peaceful people in the immediate area. It should be a ton of fun! 

If you do not have an ugly sweater you can make one (I did. It's horrendous). You can get some ideas via Google here or just come up with your own. 

PRIZE: 1 hottie chick and 1 studly dude will receive a 3-month pass to all Date Walking events for the ugliest sweater. How awesome is that?! 

While wearing an ugly sweater is not mandatory to participate, it is certainly encouraged. 

We will meet at Rocky McBride's located at[masked]rd Ave, Astoria, NY at 7PM and we will hang out there for an hour prior to departing to the next random bar. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be cancelled; however, if it snows, we still go. It is wintertime after all. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter

results.description:
Host 4 This Meetup: Monica H.

Let's meet to see the critically acclaimed movie "Creed" Starring Sylvester 

Meeting Time: Meet by the ticket machines at 7:00pm. I'll have a Meetup sign. Buy ticket at your expense. At 7:10pm we'll head into the theater to get seats. Showtime is at 7:30pm.

After the movie, we'll go to the nearby Bahama Breeze for appetizers, dinner, etc. either meeting in the lounge or at tables based on the # of people. The restaurant is at 101 Route 23 South, Wayne NJ. It's near the JC Pennys and Costco.

SYNOPSIS:
Adonis Johnson never knew his famous father, world heavy weight champion Apollo Creed, who died before he was born. Still, there's no denying that boxing is in his blood, so Adonis heads to Philadelphia, the site of Apollo Creed's legendary match with a tough upstart named Rocky Balboa. Rocky sees in Adonis the strength and determination he had known in Apollo - the fierce rival who became his closest friend.
Rating: PG-13 (for violence, language, and some sensuality) Genre: Drama
Runtime: 2 hr. 12 min.

Movie Trailer:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-HPam119fhM

results.description:
SOLD OUT!

Delicious Mediterranean vegetable-centric food inspired by cuisines from the Middle East, France, Morocco, Turkey and Italy. Menu is meatless with lots of vegan options. Great selection of cheeses (all vegetable rennet based), beers and wines that pair perfectly with the various cuisines. All food is cooked in our open kitchen and our ingredients are thoughtfully sourced, with local choices when possible. Check out our website at <a>www.rosemaryandvine.com.</a>

Westchester NY Veggie Group Offer limited to 12 seats.

First: Start off with your choice of a petite dip served with your choice of bread:

• Hummus, or

• Mouhamara


Second: Pick one of the following petites as an appetizer:

• Beets with labneh and mint (Labneh optional), or

• Roasted Cauliflower with roasted red grapes and capers, or

• Falafel with tahini sauce, pita bread, tomatoes, mint and house made turnip pickles


Third: Pick one of our cazuelas, which are our main dishes: 

• Moroccan Vegetable Tagine - butternut squash, zucchini and chickpeas. Garnished with fresh cilantro and toasted almonds, or

• French Lentil Ragout - French lentils, caramelized onions and toasted walnuts. Garnished with fresh parsley and feta (feta optional), or

• Fatoush salad - radish, cucumbers, watercress, tomatoes, arugula, lettuce with a sumac dressing and pita chips

The bases that are offered with the Moroccan Vegetable Tagine and the French Lentil Ragout are:

• brown and wild rice blend, or

• red and white quinoa, or

• couscous with scallions, or

• seasonal greens

Fourth: Top it off with one of the following delicious desserts:


• Almond Arborio-Rice pudding with ginger and cinnamon (almond milk based - no dairy), or

• Dark Chocolate Pudding with toasted almonds (coconut milk based - no dairy)


Fifth: pick 1 of our wines by the glass or a beer, bottled or on tap. Check out our online menu for wine and beer selections – call us for our current draft beer choices.

This Holiday Special is $25.26 with your choice of a beer or $28.42 with your choice of a glass of wine.

results.description:
New Years in Dubai(and Egypt) with AAT!

The rumors are true...AAT will be spending the biggest party day of the year in the biggest party city in world! Join us as we marvel at the best engineering feats of today in Dubai as well as those from yesterday in Egypt!

Please Click Here for the registration form

Please Click Here for the the detailed Itinerary  

Please Click Here to see the FAQs

How will we get around?


If this is your first time abroad or your first time in Dubai fear not, we will be escorted to all of the excursions on our itinerary using private transportation provided by SuperJet. 

Anticipated Cost 

$2250 payable in installations(minus your tell-a-friend discount!)

The first payment of $200 is non-refundable.  Afterwards, a percentage of the money received will be refundable if your plans change. Please anticipate costs for food, wine, and optional excursions.

$500 should be sufficient, but Dubai has endless sites to see and is a shopping Mecca! We cannot be held responsible for uncontrollable urges! In addition, please take into consideration the exchange rate for the AED when planning how much money to bring.

Click HERE for the current exchange rate.

Payment Dates:

$200 Deposit - June 15th – Deposit is non-refundable

$341.67 - July 15th

$341.67 - August 15th 

$341.67 - September 15th 

$341.67 - October 15th

$341.67 - November 15th 

$341.67 - December 15th 

Payment link and registration form will be available shortly.


The "Tell a friend" Discount! 

Do you know someone who may be interested in joining our trip but isn't a member of AAT ? Here is your chance to save a little money while bringing them on a trip of a lifetime! 

For every traveler that you refer to our trip, you can subtract $50 from the cost of your trip. There is no limit to the amount of people you can bring, as long as that person has not already traveled with AAT. 

Be sure to tell your friend to enter your name in the registration form(will be available soon) under "How did you hear about this trip?".


What's Included with your trip?

- Airfare to Dubai(Provided by Egypt Air) 

- Transfers to the Hotel

- Dual Occupancy Hotel stay @ Holiday Inn Downtown Dubai

- Transportation in Dubai for all excursions

- Free T- Shirt

- Transportation and Passes to the below sites: 

Dubai Museum                          Jumeriah Mosque

Burj Khalifa                                Dubai Mall

Dubai Aquarium                        Gold Souk

Please note that this trip is available exclusively as a package.  None of the above items listed may be purchased separately. 


What's NOT Included? 

Please anticipate costs for food and any optional excursion. 

Below are a lit of optional excursions that will be made available: 

• Creek  Dhow Dinner Cruise($80)    

• Desert Safari ($80)

• Ferrari World(Abu Dhabi)($110)

• Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque(Abu Dhabi)(Included in Ferrari World Price)

• NYE Party(Exact party TBD)  

• Ski Dubai($80)

• Egypt -  Tour of the Pyramids($110)

About the Holiday Inn Downtown Dubai: 

The Holiday Inn Downtown Dubai has welcomed us to stay with them for the duration of our visit. They carry a 4 star rating and are no more than 20 min cab ride from any of the sites worth seeing!

Features

For a free breakfast, free high-speed Wi-Fi and little luxuries like bathrobes and designer toiletries, book a top-floor Executive room. Suites make ideal family accommodation in downtown Dubai.

Is this trip right for you?


While we would love nothing more than to bring everyone with a passport on our trip, previous experiences has showed us that group traveling is not for everyone. Please click the below URL to read our group travel etiquette page to help determine if this trip is right for you:

Click Here

It is important to us that you not have any doubts in traveling with us. Therefore, if you have any further questions please do not hesitate to contact us at[masked] or[masked]-1236.

results.description:
We're running a fun trip to Costa Rica over the winter holidays!  This trip is limited to 12 participants and only 4 spots remain open.  If you're interested please send me (Jon) a message for a more complete itinerary (with all the activities fully explained) or if you have any questions.


Dates: 

Saturday December 26, 2015 - Sunday, January 3, 2016

Quick summary:

• 4 days / 3 nights in La Fortuna


• 2 days  / 2 nights in Monteverde


• 3 days / 3 nights in Manuel Antonio

What's included:

• Round trip airfare (JFK <--> SJO)


• 8 breakfasts, 6 lunches, 5 dinners


• ALL transportation to/from activities, hotels and airports in Costa Rica


• 3* hotels (6 nights), private 6 bedroom house in Monteverde (2 nights) - double occupancy 


• Whitewater rafting (Arenal area)


• Baldi hot springs


• Wildlife reserve visit (Arenal area)


• Cooking class


• Zip lining (Monteverde)


• Cloud Forest Reserve tour/exploration (Monteverde)


• Manuel Antonio National Park tour


• Catamaran cruise (Manuel Antonio area)


• Good people from NYC :)

Price:


• $2,499

Itinerary:

• Day 1: Meet at JFK early in the morning.  Arrive midday in San Jose then drive to La Fortuna arriving evening.  Group dinner tonight!  Meals: Dinner.  Overnight: La Fortuna

• Day 2: Rafting in Arenal during the day!  Baldi hot springs at night!  Meals: Breakfast, lunch, dinner.  Overnight: La Fortuna


• Day 3: Wildlife animal reserve visit during the day then cooking class at night.  Meals: Breakfast, lunch, dinner.  Overnight: La Fortuna


• Day 4: Drive from La Fortuna to Monteverde then relax in our ridiculously large private 6 bedroom house that's literally in the cloud forest reserve.  The pictures are ridiculous!  Meals: Breakfast, dinner.  Overnight: Monteverde (private house) 

• Day 5: Zip lining!  Then Cloud Forest Reserve tour/exploration.  Meals: Breakfast, lunch.  Overnight: Monteverde (private house)


• Day 6: Drive from Monteverde to Manuel Antonio.  Relax at the beach!  Meals: Breakfast


• Day 7: Manuel Antonio National Park exploration and relaxation!  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch.  Overnight: Manuel Antonio


• Day 8: Catamaran cruise!  Swimming, snorkeling, beach, boat.  Meals: Breakfast, lunch, dinner.  Overnight: Manuel Antonio


• Day 9: Drive from Manuel Antonio to San Jose for flight back to JFK.  Return to JFK at 9pm.

Notes

• You must live in NYC to attend this trip


• Ages 24 - 39 preferably

Message me if you want to come!

results.name: Costa Rica Trip!  12/26/15 - 1/3/16

results.description:
Hi All,

I'm getting folks together for a post-Christmas comedy show and hang at the Grisly Pear Comedy Club in the West Village and we're including free pizza (while supplies last)! If you came out to the last Saturday night show, you know you're in for a great time. We've got a great lineup of comics, who've been featured on late night shows, MTV and Comedy Central.

Tickets are $15.00, with a 2 drink minimum (normally $20, but $5 off when you mention "meetup" + drinks are cheap) and they always takes good care of us with choice tables in the performance space. Be sure to mention "meetup" to the host and they'll bring you back to the right place. You can also grab advance tix HERE, if you just wanna cruise on in. Our last show sold out.


7:15: Pizza, drinks and music from DJ Brunchy Brunch in the back area
8:00 pm: Showtime

AGE 21+

Khalid

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 6 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - Trying something new.


Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.
results.how_to_find_us: Park is right off of Kent Ave + N 10th St. - (L) Bedford Ave, or (G) Nassau Ave
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

results.description:
TWAS THE NIGHT AFTER CHRISTMAS AND ALL THROUGH THE BAR ALL THE SINGLES HAD GATHERED FROM NEAR AND FROM FAR.

THE PEOPLE WERE THERE IN HOPES THEY WOULD FIND, THAT ELUSIVE RELATIONSHIP THAT MIGHT LAST FOR SOME TIME....................

COME JOIN US AS WE RECOVER FROM ALL THE HUSTLE AND BUSTLE FOR A NIGHT OF COCKTAILS, CONVERSATIONS, DINING AND DANCING AT THE NORTH STREET TAVERN.

12 0THER SINGLE GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT.  THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE ONLY SHOWS THE ACTUAL ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP ONLY!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

JUST 35 MIN. FROM DANBURY AND PEEKSKILL, 30 MIN. FROM NORWALK AND 40 MIN FROM NYC.

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT! 

TELL A FRIEND * BRING A FRIEND

BRING SOMEONE YOU KNOW, A FRIEND, A NEIGHBOR, A CO-WORKER, OR GRAB AN EX RELATIONSHIP (ONE WITHOUT A RESTRAINING ORDER) AND GET DOWN TO ONE OF THE BEST SOCIAL MIXERS AROUND!

THE MUSIC

DJ/RADIO PERSONALITY MATT ZAKO WILL BE SPINNING TOP 40 AND RETRO TUNES  STARTING AROUND 9 PM. WE'LL HAVE ALL YOUR FAVORITE DANCE SONGS PLAYING SO THERE'S SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE'S MUSICAL TASTE!

PARKING

THERE'S PLENTY OF PARKING RIGHT IN FRONT. PLEASE USE THE SIDE ENTRANCE TO THE RIGHT.

COVER CHARGE

THERE WILL BE A $5 COVER CHARGE AT THE DOOR FOR THIS EVENT REGARDLESS WHETHER YOU'RE DINING OR JUST AT THE BAR.

PLEASE PAY AS YOU ARRIVE AND EXACT CHANGE WILL BE APPRECIATED, THANK YOU.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 30 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!

THE PEOPLE WERE THERE IN HOPES THEY WOULD FIND, THAT ELUSIVE RELATIONSHIP THAT MIGHT LAST FOR SOME TIME....................

COME JOIN US AS WE RECOVER FROM ALL THE HUSTLE AND BUSTLE FOR A NIGHT OF COCKTAILS, CONVERSATIONS, DINING AND DANCING AT THE NORTH STREET TAVERN.

12 0THER SINGLE GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT.  THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE ONLY SHOWS THE ACTUAL ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP ONLY!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

JUST 35 MIN. FROM DANBURY AND PEEKSKILL, 30 MIN. FROM NORWALK AND 40 MIN FROM NYC.

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT! 

TELL A FRIEND * BRING A FRIEND

BRING SOMEONE YOU KNOW, A FRIEND, A NEIGHBOR, A CO-WORKER, OR GRAB AN EX RELATIONSHIP (ONE WITHOUT A RESTRAINING ORDER) AND GET DOWN TO ONE OF THE BEST SOCIAL MIXERS AROUND!

THE MUSIC

DJ/RADIO PERSONALITY MATT ZAKO WILL BE SPINNING TOP 40 AND RETRO TUNES  STARTING AROUND 9 PM. WE'LL HAVE ALL YOUR FAVORITE DANCE SONGS PLAYING SO THERE'S SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE'S MUSICAL TASTE!

PARKING

THERE'S PLENTY OF PARKING RIGHT IN FRONT. PLEASE USE THE SIDE ENTRANCE TO THE RIGHT.

COVER CHARGE

THERE WILL BE A $5 COVER CHARGE AT THE DOOR FOR THIS EVENT REGARDLESS WHETHER YOU'RE DINING OR JUST AT THE BAR.

PLEASE PAY AS YOU ARRIVE AND EXACT CHANGE WILL BE APPRECIATED, THANK YOU.

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 30 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 30 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

PLEASE DON'T FORGET TO R.S.V.P. YES NOW, EVEN IF YOU'RE A MAYBE!

Thank You!

results.description:
All Aboard The Yachtza Ball! 360° views, 2 DJs, 2 Full Bars, All in Climate-Controlled Comfort.

Quicklink for Tickets: https://yachtzaball.eventbrite.com

THE YACHTZA BALL!

This event is geared for ages 20s, 30s and 40s.

We also offer The Ball for Ages 21-42 (Dec 24) and The Ball for Ages 35-55 (Dec 25)

+++

All Aboard The Yachtza Ball! 360° views, 2 DJs, 2 Full Bars, All in Climate-Controlled Comfort

+++

Set sail for Jewish Singles adventure aboard The Yachtza Ball! We'll be cruising 'round the isle of Manhattan, taking in its breathtaking skyline, pausing for a holiday visit with Lady Liberty, all from the comfort of two, climate-controlled indoor decks.

Here's the Itinerary:

• 8 pm - 9 pm: Boarding and Party Dockside

• 9 pm - 11:30 pm: We're cruising! 

• 11:30 pm - 1 am: The Party Continue Dockside

+ + +

SPONSOR

Boost your career with an MBA – the QS World MBA Tour will be visiting New York on Saturday, January 23rd at the Millennium Broadway Hotel.

Register for free to take advantage of this great opportunity to speak with top b-schools admissions directors and get personalized GMAT prep advice.

+ + +. 

ABOUT OUR YACHT

+++

• Our ship of choice for our Saturday evening voyage: The Hornblower Hybrid Yacht.  

• And no ordinary seafaring vessel is she! New York’s premier eco-friendly luxury yacht, The Hybrid Yacht offers 360-degree views from its Atrium Deck as well as first-class amenities. 

• With LED lighting, 2 DJs, 2 dance floors and full bars on both decks, this will be a Jews cruise to remember!Best of all, 

• The Yachtza Ball is included with your purchase of a Jewniversal Plus Pass (which also admits you to The Ball on December 24)! I

• f you didn't purchase a Jewniversal Plus Pass, you can purchase separate tickets to The Yachtza Ball here.

Pier 40 is located on the West Side Highway at the Houston Street (<a>directions</a>). Parking is available at the indoor parking garage adjoining the ship.

We look forward to welcoming you onboard!
results.name: The Yachtza Ball! (For Jewish Singles Ages 21-49)

results.description: For those of you is a generic holiday party. The rules are simple: show up with a gift that can be universal gift (the budget for the gift is a maximum of $20 btw). Then everyone will take a sheet of paper with a number on it. The person with the lowest number will pick a gift from the gift pile and open it. The person after will either get a new gift from the pile or steal the gift the person before them has (and that person will pick a new gift). And so in that fashion.
results.name: The day after Christmas White Elephant Party!

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:  www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

DESI SATURDAYS

Presents

BOLLYWOOD BEATS

At New York City’s Mega Nightclub & Lounge
L E X I C O N
226 East 54th Street. NYC 

Special Guest : Featuring Delhi's Finest DJ AMIT
Lexicon Resident : DJ HARSH
Dhol Percussions By : RAVI BINDRA

SPONSORED VIP OPEN BAR 9-10PM
LADIES COMPLIMENTARY ADMISSION TIL 10PM

Dress Code: Fashion Forward & Chic
Strictly No T-shirts, No Boots, No sneakers. 
21 & Over - Proper ID Required For Admission

Desi Saturdays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty.

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Saturday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Saturdays Nights at Lexicon!!
results.how_to_find_us: www.DesiSaturdays.com
results.name: Desi Saturdays presents BOLLYWOOD BEATS - A Weekly Saturday Night DesiParty

results.description:
You've worked hard all year and the boss is riding you for End Of Year Numbers! Everyone's gone home for the holidays and you're clocking in the OT! Now its time to let loose, get drunk and laugh til it hurts!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room. Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Seating and Show starts in the backroom at 9

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and celebrate the weekends with some laughs!
results.name: Let Me Speak To Your Manager- Free Comedy Show
