results.description:
Hey Guys! I thought it would be fun to all meet up at the comedy show I produce at QED. If you haven't been to QED it is a great space for all different kind of events. During the day they have cool classes like swing dancing and knitting. In the evening QED is a performance venue. QED serves beer, wine and snacks. They also have THE BEST hot apple cider you will ever taste.

This is a great chance to make new friends and to hang out with some old friends. A bunch of my friends (all different ages) come to this show as well as locals and comedy lovers. We also have an Instagram photo contest. Whoever takes the coolest photos of the event and posts them on Instagram with #hashtagcomedy will win TWO free tickets to an upcoming show! We will chose 2 winners the Monday after the show!

I hope to see you there!!

Hashtag Comedy invites some of the best comics to comment on today's hottest issues. We choose the funniest up and coming stand ups to dissect the trending topics of today's world. The show is a great opportunity to laugh and learn. So come out and buckle up its going to be a wild ride!

Doors are at 8:45
Show is 9PM!

$10 at the door or you could buy online here:

http://qedastoria.com/collections/shows/products/hashtag-comedy-6

This months lineup*:
Tracey Carnazzo
JC Knows Best
Mo Diggs
Anthony DiDomenico
Tom Daddario
Drew Michael
Aldo Marachlian
Gregory W Hall
*Lineup subject to change
results.name: Hashtag Comedy at QED in Astoria

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start and finish at the Starbucks on Queens Blvd and 46th Street.


Details: 
8:30am, Starbucks in Sunnyside. There will be TWO pace groups! One at an 8:30/9:00 minute-per-mile, and one at 10:00/10:30 minutes-per-mile.


Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance, and familiarize yourself with the posted route map. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short.

IMPORTANT: It's winter, so the water fountains are turned off in all City Parks. Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance as we'd like to make minimal stops. This is for your health, safety, and comfort.

results.description:
Great games on Christmas day everyone. Thanks for showing up. We're playing again this Sunday at Dyker Beach park; it's the artificial turf field on 14th Ave and Benson Ave. Please show up early so we can try to save a spot on the field or others will try to crowd us out.

A couple of announcements:

- I want to announce that Moe has been promoted to assistant organizer. His attendance and level/fair gamesmanship will help us to improve our meetup group. We're proud to have him on our leadership team.

- The instant tag upon touch by a defender, as opposed to the requirement of a "football move," is going along well. It has cut down on the bickering. We'll continue to use this rule and we'll monitor its progress on a continuous basis.

- Our drafting of teams by QBs hasn't gone as smoothly as we had hoped. It takes long to set up the teams, it's not a nice feeling being drafted towards the end, some ppl can't draft well, some QBs draft the same people every time, some ppl don't like being drafted by the same QB, etc. When I pick the teams I try to even it out as best as possible (of course if a QB is stellar then their team may not be as high octane because a great QB can make a team that much better as a whole than the pieces they're given). I've heard many complaints thus far with the draft system. If you have any thoughts I'm open for opinions and suggestions. I reserve the right to pick the teams so receivers are rotated with different QBs.

Sunday should be very nice weather, in the mid 60's. Come join us for some fun but please SHOW UP ON TIME!! If you show up after we started a game then you will sit out the whole first game.

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

NEW CLASS STARTS TODAY

If you are on Xmas break, now is the time to take your SCUBA Lessons. Call, email or stop in, so that we can get you started today

This is pool session one for new students starting their diving course.

Your Journey to Adventure starts today. After a brief presentation we will gear up and get started in the pool.

If you have not yet enrolled, please contact the Dive Center to get started [masked]

RSVP required

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must: 
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6

CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store.  Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

1. SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks:

"Instructors": Kelley Scharf, Andre R.

"Facility": 1-877-SCUBA-USA",

"Agency" : SDI" 

Others": Pablo M. Jay K.

Sign and date at bottom

2. SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

3. Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

results.description:
Please be sure to grab a map at the trailhead. we will go over the route, but there will be no sweep.

NY'ers can take the 743 Grand Central train that arrive at Breakneck Ridge station at 909, we will wait.


Please arrive in time to start at 9:15.

Gear: moisture-wicking clothing recommended. Map: NY/NJ Trail Conf. Map #102 or other Hudson Highland map.

Distance: Approx. 4-4.3 miles

Elevation Gain: Approx. 1,850 feet.

Duration: 2.5 hours

This fun hike will be at a moderate/quick pace for those who want to hike but have the rest of the day for other activities. Jets play at 1pm! The first 8/10th mile involves some STEEP rock scrambles.

From the Breakneck Trailhead on Rt. 9D, we will do the rock scramble up the white trail and take in the great views. We will stay on that trail to the Red trail.. Left on Red to Yellow. Turn right on yellow and climb Sugarloaf. Then back down the Yellow to Rt. 9D and to the parking lot. There will be several nice viewpoints along the trail. Bring a camera for some great photos! NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: Breakneck / sugar loaf morning hike

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).

We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

We will run rain or shine, hot or cold. If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a couple of minutes to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

results.description:
This Meetup is announced for 10am, but you can also come at 2pm.

Come riding on the beautiful trail system that spans Old Westbury-Brookville-Muttontown. All skill levels are welcome.  It's close and easy to get to from anywhere in the NYC Metro area, by car or by public transportation.

We ride in English tack, in small groups only.  Our horses are excellent: forgiving of beginners, but willing to show skilled riders a good time. If you have the skills, we'll walk-trot-canter, maybe even take a small jump.  Instruction is offered, as needed/desired.  We'll be in the saddle for at least 1 1/4 hours, probably closer to 1 3/4 hours; cost is $100 per person.  

Come discover one of the best riding opportunities in the NY Metro Area.  Don't be confined to the ring -- ride for miles through woods and fields!


We're riding every week.  If you want to come along, email me directly: [masked]

Janet

Your Meetup Organizer

results.description:
Let's run to a vintage subway train and then head to a yummy brunch (with drinks). Each year, the MTA runs classic rail cars from the 30s/40s/50s/60s on the M line between Queens Plaza and 2nd Avenue. We have organized a group outing/run to experience this annual event the last two years, and they have been a lot of fun (I mean seriously, how often do you get to ride these things?). This year, subway customers can catch the “Shoppers Special,” a train consisting of eight cars from the 1930s that ran along the lettered lines until the late 1970s. More information is available here: http://goo.gl/t91rZN

Our goal is to catch the train leaving Queens Plaza at 10:45am. To accomplish this, we will meet by the Woodside Library at 10:00am and head out for a casual pace 3ish mile run, ending at Queens Plaza. We will explore the subway cars as the train takes us into Manhattan. You will want to bring along your preferred photo-taking device. 

If you wish to add a few extra miles to your day AND enjoy a yummy brunch at Radegast Bierhall in Williamsburg after the subway ride, we will exit at 2nd Avenue and run over the Williamsburg Bridge and end there. Or, if you wish to go straight to Radegast and welcome your fellow runners with beer (or anything) after they cross the bridge, you can transfer to the L train at 14th Street. Or, you may head off to your next destination. The choice is up to you. [Note: Radegast has great brunch...lemon ricotta pancakes are out of this world. And the beverage selection just makes it all that much better.] 

Our run will be at a casual pace - you are welcome to participate as long as you are able to complete a full 3ish miles without stopping. This is for your safety and to ensure that the group does not miss the train. Please don't forget to bring along your Metrocard, and your ID if you plan to join us for brunch.
results.name: Casual Run to a Vintage Subway Train + Brunch

The first hour of practice is dedicated to beginners, so if three hours is daunting, you may come for the first hour and leave after that. All are welcome! 

Practice is lead by senior teachers Tina LaGreca and Jake La Botz and occasional visiting teachers. For more information about our teachers see the  "About Us" section. 

We have a suggested donation of $10 to $20 to support the space and the teachings. No one will ever be turned away for lack of funds.

In today’s day and age is it credible to claim that science and logic are not only not in conflict with faith but actually back it up? Does reason compel us to accept the notion of a designing Creator who cares and communicates with humanity or are we just fooling ourselves? Come judge for yourself. PRESENTERS: (bios below)
Rabbi Tzvi Gluckin, Rabbi Adam Jacobs, Harold Gans & Max Anteby MORNING PROGRAM:
10:00 - 10:30 Registration & light breakfast
10:30 - 11:30 Class 1 - The First Commandment Is To Think! (Rabbi Gluckin)
11:30 - 12:45 Class 2 - She Blinded Me: The Limits of Scientific Inquiry (Rabbi Jacobs)
12:45 - 1:00 Class 3 - The Moon Cycle Code (Rabbi Gluckin)
1:00 - 1:30 Chinese Buffet AFTERNOON PROGRAM:
1:30 - 2:30 Class 4 - Where is God? (Harold Gans)
2:30 - 3:30 Class 5 - The 7 Wonders of Jewish History (Max Anteby)
3:30 - 4:30 Class 6 - The Origin Of Life (Harold Gans)

results.description:
http://nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/poppies.jpg?itok=zaUSOchH  Dr. Anne Klaeysen, Leader 

All of us are touched by loss. So it is that on this last Sunday of the year, we set aside time to reflect before embarking upon a new year. We remember our dead, honor those who have profoundly touched our lives, and immortalize them in the ways we choose to conduct our lives. We face tomorrow with hope made stronger by the lessons we have learned and the love we have shared.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.
results.how_to_find_us: Ceremonial Hall
results.name: Sunday Meeting: Remembrance Sunday

group.name: New York Society for Ethical Culture

results.description:
Quietly, peacefully mend and meld mind and spirit as prescribed by the  Master Messengers throughout the Ages —  Jesus, Siddhārtha Gautama, Mohammad, Confucius, Handsome Lake, Lao Tzu, White Buffalo Calf Woman, The Peacemaker, Zoroaster, Mahavira, Mani, to name a few.

We do not defend, or offend, any particular religion or belief system, or anthropomorphize any deity.  

Instead, we aim to personify the Mind-Spirit connection through the words of the Masters, and make it our way of life in order to:

  • Build and maintain excellent character, as is our birthright.

  • Embody active compassion as a celebration of life and living.

  • Clarify and awaken the God within as both a journey and a destination.

  • Reunite the positive (Spirit) with the powerful (Mind) in us all to actualize our awesome potential.

That's the goal of our 11:00 a.m. Sunday Gathering.

At 12:00 p.m., leave refreshed, renewed, and re-energized, and in control of what comes next.

Speaking of what comes next, we sometimes commune afterward  by way of food, drink, and conversation.  It would be great if you joined us!

Consider it.

We look forward to your company. 


Respectfully,


Rev. Alexander

results.description:
We invite you to join us for an ECKANKAR Worship Service on spirituality in everyday life. Every 4th Sunday, 11am - noon.

Sample Topics

• Discover the Secret of God’s Love
• Accepting Spiritual Guidance
• Past Lives–Have You Lived Before?
• The Amazing Toolbox of Life
• Dreams—A Doorway to Heaven
• What is the Spiritual Purpose of Life?

Everyone Welcome!

The ECK Worship Service is for people of all faiths who love God. Led by a member of the ECK clergy, each service focuses on an aspect of Eckankar and features a reading from the ECK works, singing HU, and an open discussion of spiritual principles at work in daily life.

ECKANKAR Center
11 Park Street, Montclair, NJ
There is on-street parking and two municipal parking lots in the area. Please pay particular attention to meters and parking signs. (Metered parking is free evenings after 7pm and on Sundays.)

For more information on the service or other events being held throughout the state, visit www.eckankar-nj.org.

Presented by the Satsang Society of New Jersey, Inc.,
a Chartered Affiliate of ECKANKAR, Religion of the Light and Sound of God.

The terms ECKANKAR, ECK, EK, MAHANTA, SOUL TRAVEL and VAIRAGI, among others are trademarks of ECKANKAR.    Copyright ©2012 ECKANKAR. All rights reserved. ECKANKAR P.O. Box 2000 Chanhassen, MN[masked] USA

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating.  If you have questions regarding this event contact the host directly at [masked] or call[masked] 

80% of this tour takes place under cover or inside! Enjoy a fresh and different way to enjoy a Sunday Afternoon with others. Learn tons of cool things on the tour and ride a vintage NYC Subway Car that was in service from the 1930's.

Our tours are designed for fun and friendly members of NYSN and our partner social networking groups.  This is not a tour for tourists but for people who live in and around NY or who are new to the area who want to learn more about the city they live in and the amazing things they are surrounded by every day!  Celebrate the 101 year anniversary of Grand Central with this fun and informative to while socializing with members and friends from NYSN and other Social Networking Groups. Did you know that the current Grand Central building is actually the 3rd incarnation of the historic building on that site?  Learn about Secret platforms, top secret rooms and interesting facts and surprises during this adventure filled with exploring, socializing and learning.  Your tour guide will also share  photos from the late 1800’s and early 1900’s that will  amaze you and change your perspective on the building and the neighborhood surrounding it.

Sign up today and meet other fun people in our group while really getting a different perspective on one of  New York’s most famous landmarks and the neighborhood surrounding it Plus have a chance to ride through history in a classic subway car that will make you appreciate today's subway cars.

The Group will meet in front  of  The Puck Fair Tavern on Broadway-Lafayette street at 11am sharp.  We will then take the nostalgia train to 42nd street Bryant Park and walk over to Grand Central for the Tour.  You will need to swipe your metro card for the Nostalgia Train.

Train info

What to wear:  casual

What to expect: 20 -30 fun and friendly people looking to learn a little about the city and meet new people.

Following the tour the group will go to a local tavern for food and drinks

Cost $15 is for tour only.  Please bring exact change.  You will need to swipe your metro card once

Group host Dave Cervini[masked]
results.name: NY Tours For New Yorkers: Grand Central History & Nostalgia Train Ride

results.description:
We will show excerpts and discuss the documentary film of the same name. It’s human nature to lie, and we all do it. The Truth About Lies explores the complex impact dishonesty has on our lives and every day society. Weaving experiments by behavioral economist Dan Ariely with personal stories from individuals affected by the unraveling of their lies, we will explore the forces behind our behavior and many truths behind our lies.

Everyone is welcome to attend our Sunday morning platform meetings.

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating.  If you have questions regarding this event contact the host directly at [masked] or call[masked] 

You will not look at the famous holiday decorations in the same way!  Join us for this fun afternoon of exploring, socializing, and holiday spirit as you set out to visit and find clues that are a part of the famous holiday decorations from Herald Square to Rock Center.  Along the way you will also learn some interesting historical facts about the city that you live in. 

The group will meet at St Pat's  midtown pub on 46th, head out for the hunt then return to the same pub where we will be hosting another brunch event that you can become a part of!  It's two events for the price of one!

Here is how it works: 

-Arrive at St Pat's at 11:30am for coffee, tea, hot chocolate and registration.  If you don't have a team we will set you up with other fun people.  98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

-After you are set up on a team we will send you out for 90 minutes to find as many of the clues as you can.

-Teams return to St Pat's for food and drinks as we tally up the scores and announce the winners. You will be joining our brunch party (but there is no obligation to eat). 

What will we be looking for?  You will be looking for clues that are part of the famous holiday decorations that are between Herald Square and Rockefeller Center (how many nutcrackers are in Rock Center, what color are the balls on the Bryant Park Tree,  How many elves in the Macy's Windows, etc)  You will also have to look for other historical clues that are part of the history of NYC!

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.  If you don't have a team we will set you up with other fun people.

Dress code: Bundle up, we go snow or shine! Tickets are non refundable unless hunt is canceled due to dangerous weather conditions.

What to expect: 20-30 participants

Please bring exact change: $10
results.name: Holiday Decorations/Midtown History Scavenger Hunt & Party

results.description:
GET ON LINE AS SOON AS YOU ARRIVE. WE'LL MEET AFTER WE LEAVE, AT 1 PM, OUTSIDE THE ENTRANCE. BUT I'LL LOOK FOR YOU ON THE LINE AND INSIDE THE MUSEUM. OR LOOK FOR ME IN MY RED CAP. 

The Frick, housed in the Gilded-Age mansion of industrialist Henry Clay Frick, contains more masterpieces per square foot than any museum in the world. In addition, it is currently displaying the first major exhibition in the U.S of Andrea Del Sarto, one of the greatest Renaissance artists. We'll leave at around 1 PM, when pay-what-you-wish admission ends. Weather permitting, we'll then we'll walk through the park to the Museum of Natural History (also pay what you wish), where we'll have lunch in the cafeteria and see my favorite permanent exhibitions; you can explore on your own if you prefer. (If it's raining, we'll either go to an inexpensive nearby restaurant for lunch or walk 12 blocks to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, where we'll dine in the cafeteria; I'll keep you posted later in the week.) If time and weather allow, we'll finish with another short walk in the park.


PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING DETAILS SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED.

DISTANCE: 1-2  miles, depending on how long you stay. We'll finish at around 4:30 PM, but you can leave earlier, of course.

PACE: Moderate NOT SLOW between museums and in the park. 

LUNCH: Around 1:30. You can bring your own food if we're going to a museum cafeteria rather than a restaurant (I'll keep you posted), but please buy at least something as a courtesy.

COST: Pay what you wish at both museums, plus $2 for me (in part to cover Meetup's organizer fee),  and whatever you pay for food.

TRANSPORTATION: #6 train to 68th St (closest) or N,Q,R to 5th Ave/59th St. 

For more details, consult mta.tripplanner.org, Google Transit (maps.google.com/landing/transit/index.html) and/or a subway map, since those sites do not always list the ideal routes. Also check mta.info/weekender for weekend service changes.

WAITING LIST: Sign up and be patient, no matter how many are waiting. The list will dwindle or even disappear because of cancellations, especially at the last minute. As a courtesy to others waiting for a spot, please do not sign up unless you intend to go, rather than just as a placeholder in case nothing better turns up.
results.name: Frick Collection, Museum of Natural History & Central Park

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 9:45AM (2 hours before the start time)


• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.


Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club or activities.
results.how_to_find_us: Coach Moe will be wearing a neon yellow pinnie.

results.description:
Play 3v3 & 4v4 (without keepers), and 5v5 (with keepers) for an hour on the best turf product in the city.

[Please note: the number of players and the willingness of people to play in goal will determine the format. Also: If we have all 12 spots filled, we will have three teams of four, rotating every five minutes - so that one team plays for ten minutes, then sits for five - over 1.5 hours.]

Everything provided (e.g., EPL ball and pillowy soft pinnies) - including warm and dry-conditions.

Before coming, please read the facility rules here: http://www.thepitchbrooklyn.com/rules/

* No plastic molded cleats and no metal cleats are allowed on the pitch. You can wear rubber-studded cleats, indoor shoes and sneakers.

* Shin guards are also required.

* Cash-only payments this week.

results.description:
If you feel like burning some calories after the holidays lunch and dinner excess, join us for a walk over the bridge and into the Brooklyn Bridge Park. We will traverse the park to Pier 6, where a Marina is being built, and then stroll back to Dumbo and Brooklyn Heights, where you can take the subway back.

We will meet at 12:00pm noon in Manhattan outside the Starbucks near the Brooklyn Bridge, you can get there with the 4,5,6, A, C, 2, 3 subways. After a 15 min wait for meet and greet we will start walking across the Brooklyn Bridge. There will be plenty of photograph opportunities in these historic districts for those who like taking pictures. 


The 3.5 mile walk should take less than 2 hours, at a normal pace 


Things to remember:


• Rain or blizzard conditions cancels the meetup


• You join the meetup at your own risk, organizers are not liable

• If you arrive late and need to find us, you can reach me at[masked]

Hey folks - we have an opportunity to play on the turf fields at Parade Grounds and give our ankles a break from the picnic house field. Field is the grey area on the upper right side of the park; come in from Parade Place or Caton Ave. (This is the area where Morning Disc plays) 

I will set up the field as Morning Disc leaves. Come work off that holiday meal. Message me if you don't know where this is.

BEGINNERS WELCOME! if you're new, haven't played in a while, forgot how to play, don't play that much, or just don't care about being ultra-competitive, now is definitely the time to come out and play. You'll get plenty of playing time with people willing to give you pointers and let you do your thing on the field. Play as much or as little as you like and get some throwing practice in.

Bring a white and dark shirt and water and whatever else you might need to rock socks at frisbee.

See you there,

kar

venue.name: Morningside Park

results.description:
Updated December 18th, 2015

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.
results.why: It's fun and you like it...
results.how_to_find_us: Look for flying discs...
results.name: Sunday Ultimate @ 12PM, Riverside Park

results.description: There was once a time when there were no Japanese people in St.Mark's Place, but Germans. Did you know this? Our tour will last about an hour and we will then go to Grand Sichuan, a famous and inexpensive Chinese restaurant. $15 will be enough if you decide to come. Any questions? Let me know and see you there!

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)

results.description:
Let's spend a leisure afternoon at the Morgan, check out the exhibitions and then enjoy the sound of music while sipping a coffee or ordering a full brunch...at your discretion.


Charles Dickens


Every holiday season, the Morgan displays Charles Dickens's original manuscript of A Christmas Carol in Pierpont Morgan's historic library.
Read more here: http://www.themorgan.org/exhibitions/charles-dickens-a-christmas-carol

Martin Puryear


One of the most important contemporary American sculptors, Martin Puryear (b. 1941) has also made drawings throughout his career. This exhibition is the first to highlight the important role that drawing plays in his practice. Featuring about 70 works—primarily drawings, but also prints, and a few sculptures—the exhibition explores the evolution of Puryear’s ideas across different media. Most of the drawings come from the artist's collection and have never been exhibited before.  http://www.themorgan.org/exhibitions/martin-puryear

Henri Matisse


World renowned for his paintings, sculptures, drawings, and cut-outs, Henri Matisse (1869–1954) also embraced the printed book as a means of artistic expression. Between 1912 and his death in 1954, he was engaged in nearly fifty book illustration projects, many produced with his direct involvement in page layout, typography, lettering, ornament, and cover design. He planned these publications with his characteristic vigilance and zeal, seeking a perfect fusion of image and text. Some thirty of these modern masterpieces will be on view for the first time together in this landmark exhibition exploring the decisive role book production played in Matisse’s career. http://www.themorgan.org/exhibitions/graphic-passion


...and more...check out ALL current exhibitions at the Morgan: http://www.themorgan.org/exhibitions/current

As if it weren't already a cornucopia of visual pleasure, free Jazz music will make this a perfectly decadent Holiday Sunday afternoon...

Sunday Afternoon Jazz


Musicians from The New School for Jazz & Contemporary Music play in the Morgan's Gilbert Court, and the Morgan Café features a festive jazz brunch to complete to complement the experience.

Weekend music is free with museum admission. 
http://www.themorgan.org/programs/sunday-afternoon-jazz



For admission information follow this link: http://www.themorgan.org/visit/hours-and-admission

READ CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU CHOOSE TO RSVP.

1. If you RSVP and DO NOT SHOW UP for TWO events, you will be REMOVED from this group.

2. If you RSVP and change your status to "not attending" AFTER THE RSVP HAS BEEN CLOSED, you will be marked as "no show".

3. We DO NOT WAIT for late people. If you are late, you will be marked as "no show"

4. If less than 5 people RSVP for this event, it MAY be cancelled.
If it is cancelled meetup.com will automatically send you an email to inform you of the cancellation.
Make sure your email preferences for this group allow for you to receive communications for "Changes to a Meetup I'm going to"

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Tour
ADMISSIONS: $2.75

DESCRIPTION:


MTA New York City Transit and the New York Transit Museum are putting extra magic on the tracks with the Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s annual holiday tradition of rides to the past via its vintage fleet of buses and subway trains – and the chance for transit fans to buy museum merchandise at a special station pop-up shop.

The holiday nostalgia fleet includes subway cars from the 1930s and buses from the late 1940s to the 1980s. The New York Transit Museum typically displays these vehicles during special events at the museum or around the city, but are offering these holiday nostalgia rides to the public for a limited time with the swipe of a MetroCard. Some vintage buses also will be on display at Union Square, Herald Square and at the Circle Line Terminal.

For four consecutive Sundays in December, subway customers can catch the “Shoppers Special,” a train consisting of eight cars from the 1930s that ran along the lettered lines until the late 1970s. The cars, which were ordered for the Independent Subway System (IND), were the first subway cars to be identified by their contract numbers, hence the R1/9 designations. R1/9 cars, known as ““City-Cars,” have rattan seats, ceiling fans, incandescent light bulbs, and roll signs for passenger information. Their design of more doors that were also wider and faster, plus increased standing capacity to accommodate crowds, served as the model of modern subway cars, and their dimensions are identical to the latest R160 cars. They were retired from service in 1977.

ATTRACTIONS:

• Vintage Subways Rides from the 1930's and up

• Actors in 1930's Dress Performance

http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-71rUpbo9sw8/Tu1gTw3-2vI/AAAAAAAAOSc/g1lKOyTMFFc/s1600/DSC_0425.JPG

• Music from the 1930's

http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-y8stutftxqs/Tu1lH5v_GzI/AAAAAAAAOUM/pwWblx6sQGU/s1600/DSC_0518.JPG

WEATHER: 
Event is Indoors

MAP: 

https://www.google.com/maps/dir/21+St+-+Queensbridge+%5BF%5D/2nd+Avenue+%5BF%5D/@40.7453762,-73.9900142,14z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m14!4m13!1m5!1m1!1s0x89c258d6b30fab3b:0x77e2cb2e53015e9d!2m2!1d-73.9424742!2d40.7541777!1m5!1m1!1s0x89c2598465e5fc85:0x8173505c2f7ec42e!2m2!1d-73.9912918!2d40.7239366!3e3


REFERENCE:

http://www.mta.info/news-nostalgia-ride-vintage-bus-vintage-train-subway-bus/2015/11/25/mta-new-york-city-transit-ny

results.description:
We will meet at 1 P.M. at the front of the Manhattan bound platform! I am saying 1 p.m. because people may have train issues and get there a tiny bit late, but you should plan to get there for 1 p.m.  If you're late, you may miss your train!  (so, in other words, better to plan to be there early than to get there late and miss us!)  The train won't leave the station at 1 p.m., but we need to meet there at 1 p.m. to all be there together to take the train.

Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s annual holiday tradition of rides to the past via its vintage fleet of buses and subway trains. The holiday nostalgia fleet includes subway cars from the 1930s and buses from the late 1940s to the 1980s. The New York Transit Museum typically displays these vehicles during special events at the museum or around the city, but are offering these holiday nostalgia rides to the public for a limited time with the swipe of a MetroCard.


We will catch the “Shoppers Special,” a train consisting of eight cars from the 1930s that ran along the lettered lines until the late 1970s.  We will ride it to the "end of the line", where we can check out a special pop-up museum shop! Then we can either ride it back, or head out on your own to where-ever you need to get to!

VINTAGE FLEET HIGHLIGHTS:

Subway Car No. 100: Manufactured by American Car & Foundry, this R1-type car was the first car in the initial order of 300 placed in service for the opening of the IND subway.

Subway Car No. 484: Part of a 500-car order of R4 cars manufactured by American Car & Foundry. In 1946, this car received a retrofit of bulls-eye lighting and a public address system.

Subway Car No. 1575: Originally manufactured as an R7, this car was sent to the American Car & Foundry factory and rebuilt as prototype of the next generation R10 subway car.

Subway Car No. 6095: In 1925, the Brooklyn-Manhattan Transit Corporation (BMT) introduced a three-car articulated unit called the D-Type Triplex. The design meant passengers could walk from one car to another in the unit through an enclosed passageway. They carried more passengers and had fewer moving parts, making them efficient and easier to maintain.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: 

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Let's meet at Grand Army Plaza at the northwest corner of Prospect Park. If that's way out of your way we can meetup along the ride.

This will be a safe, non-technical ride at a more medium than high pace - but prep those legs because we will crush 5 bridges on 1 gear! From Grand Army Plaza we'll head up Vanderbuilt Ave and make our way to the Kent Ave bike path, taking it through Williamsburg and then on to Greenpoint where we'll cross the Pulaski bridge. We'll follow the edge of Queens on Vernon Blvd and then climb the Queensboro bridge, the highest of the 5, with an epic view of the city and a tight, two-way bike lane shared with pedestrians. In Manhattan we'll spend most of the time riding straight down 2nd Ave on our way to the Williamsburg bridge, the longest of the 5. We'll be retracing some steps as we make our way to the Manhattan bridge which, along with the Brooklyn bridge, we'll use to zig-zag to Manhattan and finally back to Brooklyn.

For this ride we trade pace and technicality for strength, and it's going to hurt in the best possible way! Afterwards if anyone wants to hang we can grab a drink or food in the hood - we'll have earned it!
results.name: 3 Boro 5 Bridge Bike Tour

results.description:
Greetings, STSANY members and friends:

MANY THANKS!!! to those of you who have volunteered to perform with us at this event: Lourdes Ayala, Co-Organizer of STSANY, Sheri Crain, Christine Petit, Reginald Saffold and Kuba, Nelly and Son, Elsa O'Reilly and Jessica Corbin, our pianist/singer. 

NOTE: When you volunteer you make someone happy, you feel good about yourself, you work with and socialize with fellow STSANY members, you network and you have a lot of fun. 

Here are some songs to be performed on our program:

https://www.youtube.com/watch…
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1p5FBFdYufk

OTHER SONGS INCLUDE: Christmas songs from Puerto Rico, "Christmas Time is Here," "The Dreidl Song" and several popular holiday songs. Also: poems and personal stories about the holidays by our performers.

Professionals as well as non-semi professionals are welcome to volunteer. 

Details:


We'll meet at 2:15 in the lobby.

Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center: 1275 York Avenue, between 67th/68th Street, 15th Floor. Contact: Guirlaine Duvert, Adult Recreation:[masked]-5978. 

TAKING PHOTOS: IMPORTANT: You can bring your cameras or video cameras to take photos before or after the event. NO CAMERAS OR VIDEO CAMERAS ALLOWED during the event. (We can take a group photo of the group before we enter the hospital or when we leave, and post it on our website.)

NOTE: If you must cancel, please do so before Dec. 25, i.e., change your RSVP to "no." NO-SHOWS AND LAST MINUTE CANCELLATIONS FOR EVENTS ARE NOT ACCEPTABLE unless you have a dire emergency. Be sure of your schedule before you commit to a particular event. You need not commit to all of them.

NOTE: STSANY is a cooperative creative arts meetup. We commit to working together on volunteer and other events during the year.  We're all busy, but we can always find time to do something worthwhile. 

I look forward to working with you on these events and those in the future.

Best wishes,

Anna

www.annabartos.com

Original posting about our December events:

VOLUNTEER EVENTS: MAKING SOMEONE HAPPY! 

Would you like to make someone happy during the December holidays and at future events? You can sing (solo and in the ensemble), act, read a poem or story, or play an instrument in a fun holiday or other event, some replete with costumes, make-up and lots of good spirit. 

We are encouraging new members or those who have not volunteered at our previous events to step up and be counted! 

STSANY volunteers to perform for kids and adults/seniors in hospitals, shelters, schools (concentrating on kids in need who don't get to see live performances), community centers, etc. 

"Looking for Christmas: Purrrlock Holmes' Marvelous Holiday Adventure," a musical/theatrical event, will explore the meaning of Christmas, Chanukah and other similar holidays of giving. The main protagonist is Purrrlock Holmes, a lively, funny, spunky feline who can sing and act.

Volunteer to make connections with some venues you know or find,  and work with fellow members to schedule various events for December and throughout the year. 

Thank you!

Cheers, 
Anna

results.description:
No preparation needed for this meeting! Just bring up to 1,500 words of writing—a flash piece or an excerpt from a longer piece you are working on or the outline of an idea that you need help with. People are encouraged to bring work generated through Writing Room exercises.

The format works like this:

Each writer gets a total of up to 30 minutes, which begins when they read their piece aloud or give a pitch of their idea in five minutes or less. We will be able to do 4 or 5 pieces/ideas per meeting. Names will be drawn at random. (Anyone whose work is not chosen will get priority at the next meeting.) You don’t need to bring work to attend and no advance preparation is required.

Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

See you there!

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 4 spots besides myself for this meetup.


Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 4 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 4 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place:

As NYMag stages: With its ultra-modern décor and cozy French fare, Amelie adds a chic and unmistakably European vibe to its eclectic Greenwich Village block. Inside, a bright-red bar top above sleek white floors creates a contemporary feeling; it’s balanced by low lighting and an attentive staff. Menus clipped to vintage record albums add a playful touch. 


http://www.ameliewinebar.com/


RSVPs:


Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. If there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to be able to do so. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

Dear friends,

Last Sunday's Chatty Concert at Caffe Vivaldi was truly magical. 

A new Classical for All follower said she feels like she just took a crash course in classical music, she learned so much while enjoying the music and the atmosphere. "You don't feel "left out", which happens sometimes in classical music concerts, you start thinking this isn't something I would understand, but here it was the opposite. I'll bring my friends every Sunday!" 

Join us this week for an amazing time!

"Chatty Pianist" Emir GAMSIZOGLU; www.emirgamsiz.com

results.description:
Bring a bottle of wine, or some cheeze and biscuts ; let us have a Holiday get to gether for making new friends.  Last Summer we had a "Who are You"  picnic that was a lot of fun. 

This will be a  get  together where everyone will have 5 minutes to tell us about their childhood years, - their roots, - the years between 0 and ten years old.   The last minute will be devoted to telling us about who they are now, at this point in time .

This is a good format for everyone meeting everyone at once.....    It is also an interesting opportunity to hear and  understand some of the cultural roots of others.  The cultural roots that help determine who we are today. 

This is a party. .... "who are you"  is just a part of the  afternoon.  If you do not know who you are, or what you come from.....feel free to make something up.

results.description:
Join us as we continue our THRONES Countdown to Season 6!

We start with all of Season 1 and go straight through to the end of Season 5. Guess what? By the time we finish all five seasons together it will be time for Season 6!!! Yay! We can socialize  from 5PM to 5:30PM, then we begin the show at 5:30 promptly. A short intermission for reactions, then the second show. We have to clear out by 8PM.


This week we have Season 3:


Episode 1 "Valar Dohaeris"

Episode 2 "Dark Wings, Dark Words"


All are welcome. If you have never watched Game of Thrones before and want to see what all the fuss is about, come on in and be enlightened. If you are a full fledged Maester trying to survive the Long Night between seasons come join us and watch the marvelous series again while vicariously enjoying the newbies reactions to the Game of Thrones.

NOTE- Newbies must identify themselves so us Maesters will have notice that you are there so we turn off MST3000 level of commentary!


You can BYOF (bring your own food) and BYOB (bring your own beer and/or other drinks). There is a 7/11 on 33rd and Madison, a Wendys and a Smashburger and $1 Pizza on 33rd and 5th, and a Chipotle on 31st and Park (and other eats nearby too).
results.name: Game of Thrones Series Recap- Season 3 Episodes 1 & 2

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/

                                         Run & Drinks!

Stay Motivated 

Or You'll Gain 10 Pounds  

Of Holiday Fat!

During the Holiday Season there will be lots of delicious choices of delicacies and deserts and

Tons Of CALORIES!

So get your metabolism into high gear and earn your Holiday appetite and

Stay Motivated!

The New York City Runners Group keeps you motivated to run and to keep running. 

Join Us As We Run

And Then Go For Drinks! 

After we run and get our metabolism into high gear, we'll go for drinks and reward ourselves for our efforts and spread some New Year's Cheer! 

Get Going

Get Tough

Get Results!

Reach Your Goals

Look Great - Feel Great

Get In The Best Shape Of Your Life In 2016

Make A Commitment

To Achieve Your Goals!

There Is Often A Big Gap Between

Our Good Intentions And Our Actions.

-The Dalai Lama

Want To Run A Marathon In 2016?

A Half Marathon?

A 5K Race?


Or - Do You Just Want Motivation

To Get In Great Shape?


- Motivation -

The Difference Between

Busting Your Ass

Or Just Scratching It.

Photos From Our Runs

Our group is a group of runners of all different skill levels from mostly professional fields.

Great people to run and to socialize with.

Plus, after just your first run with us, the run and the running tips you receive, will make you a better and faster runner.

Guaranteed.

Get Motivated Stay Fit!

The Central Park Reservoir Loop

Sunday, December 27th

The 1 train stops on 86th & Broadway.

Reservoir Loop Map & Details

I'll be wearing a black DGA (Directors Guild of America) baseball hat and I have blond hair.

As always, there will be a place to keep your stuff while we run.

For New Members And First Time Runners:

It's cool if you're just getting going as a runner. You won't be the only one. I'll give you running tips & you'll improve rapidly.

We're a cool & friendly bunch.You'll get inspired and have fun and soon you'll be in great shape.

After we run & our endorphins have kicked in for a turbo-blast known as a runner's high, we'll go have drinks & socialize.

We'll be going to a nearby cool Bar/Lounge where we can have a drink or two and socialize.

- Marcello

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leader- Joanne)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 5:45pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:00pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Corner kicks.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The fee is  $4 via paypal, The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If the game is canceled, please go to this link <http://ps2g.org/games/refund-request>; for a refund.

Each week following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity dozens of people get together following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity for socializing, eating, beverages and connecting.  It is a fun and casual way to meet others in the group in a fun and relaxed setting.

You can meet the group on the steps to the church following mass and walk over together or you can meet the group at the bar.  It is easy to find us.


Joe's Bar is a casual pub offering good beer and great food, and it's right around the corner.  Grab a seat at the bar or you can sit at a table to eat and drink.

Pay as you go for food and drink. A full menu is available

Can I come alone? Yes, many of those attending come on their own.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to attend? No, people come from all over the tri state area to our events.

Do I need to go to the 5:30 mass to go to the gathering?  No, you can attend your home parish and join us for the party. 

How long does it last?

Usually around 9ish

results.description:
TRANSFORMATIONAL POETRY and Short Stories - Sunday at 7 pm


“The birds have vanished into the sky,

  and the last clouds  have drained away.

 We sit together, the Mountain and me,

 Until only the Mountain remains.”  Li Po  701_762 AD  (Chinese Poet)

We will read and discuss various Transformational Poems that Resonate and bring us to “Wonder, Mystery and Oneness”.  Among the poets we will explore are: Mary Oliver, Rumi, Ryokan, Li Po, Rilke, Basho, Antonia Machado, Hafiz, Lao Tzu, Chuang Tzu and many others. 

No previous experience is necessary.  If you have favorite poems, please bring their work with you to share. You could even bring your own poem, the more poems we have, the richer the experience will be.


TIMES 7:00 to 8:30 pm starting Sunday Dec 20th until Jan 17th. You can come to any session, they are not consecutive. We will start at 7:00 pm sharp, so please come at least by 6:45.

PLACE: All Souls Unitarian Church 80th Street and Lexington Avenue.

BRING:  Please bring PAPER and PENCIL

FREE: A small donation ($1 to $5) would be appreciated for the Room rental and Clean-Up

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 6:00AM.  Don't be late.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike
